item.title: [HBASE-11869] Support snapshot owner
item.description:
In current codebase, the table snapshot operations only can be done by the global admin , not by the table admin.

There is a multi-tenant hbase cluster, each table has different snapshot policies, eg: do snapshot per week, or snapshot after the new data are imported.
We want to release the snapshot permission to each table admin.

According to Matteo Bertozzi's suggestion, we implement the snapshot owner feature.

  • The user with table admin permission can create snapshot and the owner of this snapshot is this user.
  • The owner of snapshot can delete and restore the snapshot.
  • Only the user with global admin permission can clone a snapshot, for this operation creates a new table.

Sorry to come in late, but in regular acl's we got rid of table's owner, because it was an orthogonal model to ACLs, and was not as flexible. Can we maintain the snapshot permissions similar to regular table permissions, and have the same model for tables and snapshots?

Doc to be added when this is committed (just keeping track)

<para>Prior to HBase 0.94.1, a table could have an owner, which could be different from the
table creator, and was stored in the column descriptor. This was removed by <link
xlink:href="https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-6188">HBASE-6188</link>, and
instead, the creator of the table is considered its owner.</para>
<para>As of <link xlink:href="https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-11869">HBASE-11889</link>, you can also assign
HBase Tables have a new metadata attribute <literal>OWNER</literal>, which is added to
snapshots taken on that table, and designates who can restore the table from a snapshot. By default, the
owner is the user principal who creates the table, though it may be changed at table
creation time or during an <command>alter</command> operation by setting or changing the
<option>OWNER</option> table attribute. Only a single user principal can own a table at
a given time. A table owner is implicitly granted all permissions to a given table.
</para>
